best_practices: Always run npx prisma generate after schema changes to update client types
Use select instead of include when you only need specific fields to improve performance
Create a singleton PrismaClient instance to avoid connection exhaustion in development
anti_patterns: Do not use url field in datasource block in v7 - move it to prisma.config.ts
Do not pass prisma:// URLs to driver adapters - use them only with Prisma Accelerate
Do not forget to add "type": "module" in package.json for ESM support

faq.question: Is Prisma v7 backward compatible with v6?
faq.answer: No, v7 requires ESM, driver adapters, and prisma.config.ts. Migration from v6 requires code changes.

faq.question: What databases does Prisma v7 support?
faq.answer: PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB, SQLite, CockroachDB, PlanetScale, Neon, Cloudflare D1, and MSSQL with appropriate adapters.

faq.question: How do I configure the Prisma client in v7?
faq.answer: Use prisma.config.ts for database URL and CLI config. Set generator provider to "prisma-client" with custom output path.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a read-only documentation skill. It provides guidance without accessing any databases or executing code.

faq.question: Why am I getting module resolution errors?
faq.answer: Ensure "type": "module" in package.json, run npx prisma generate, and verify the output path matches your import path.

faq.question: How does v7 differ from v6?
faq.answer: v7 requires ESM, removes Rust dependencies, uses driver adapters instead of built-in drivers, and moves config to prisma.config.ts.
